contentrichtext.text: {{About|a city in the Netherlands|the french ethnographer|Arnold van Gennep}} {{Infobox settlement |official_name = Gennep | image_skyline = Gennep vanuit toren.jpg | imagesize = | image_caption = | image_flag = Flag of Gennep.svg | flag_size = 120x100px | image_shield = Gennep.svg | shield_size = 120x100px |image_map = LocatieGennep.png |mapsize = 250px |latd=51|latm=41|lats=37|latNS=N |longd=5|longm=48|longs=22|longEW=E |coordinates_display = inline,title |coordinates_region = NL-LI |subdivision_type = Country |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = [[Limburg (Netherlands)|Limburg]] |area_footnotes = (2006) |area_total_km2 = 50.40 |area_land_km2 = 48.02 |area_water_km2 = 2.38 |population_as_of = 1 January, 2007 |population_note = Source: [[Statistics Netherlands|CBS]], [http://statline.cbs.nl/ Statline]. |settlement_type = Municipality |population_total = 16865 |population_density_km2 = 351 |timezone = [[Central European Time|CET]] |utc_offset = +1 |timezone_DST = [[Central European Summer Time|CEST]] |utc_offset_DST = +2 }} '''Gennep''' ({{Pronunciation|131 Gennep.ogg}}) is a [[municipality]] and a [[city]] in southeastern [[Netherlands]]. == Population centres == [[Aaldonk]], Dam, De Looi, Diekendaal, Gennep, [[Heijen]], Hekkens, [[Milsbeek]], [[Ottersum]], Smele, [[Ven-Zelderheide]] and Zelder. == The city of Gennep == [[File:Stadhuisgennep.jpg|thumb|left|130px|Gennep, former town hall, on the left the new town hall]] Gennep was the title of a comital family, known descendants of which are the famous [[Saint Norbert of Gennep]] and [[Wilhelm von Gennep|William of Gennep]], [[Archbishop-Elector of Cologne]]. Gennep probably received [[City rights in the Netherlands|city rights]] in 1371. However, it remains unclear whether these city rights have really been assigned to Gennep, as the supposed documents burned during a fire in the townhall of Gennep at the end of the 16th decade. Gennep lies about 18 km southeast of [[Nijmegen]]. In 2001, Gennep had 8306 inhabitants. The built-up area of the town was 2.11 km², and contained 3124 residences.<ref name="CBS">Statistics Netherlands (CBS), ''Bevolkingskernen in Nederland 2001'' [http://www.cbs.nl/nl-NL/menu/themas/milieu-natuur-ruimte/ruimte/publicaties/cartografie-geografie/geografische-data/2001-bevolkingskernen-in-nederland.htm]. Statistics are for the continuous built-up area.</ref> ==International relations== {{Main|List of twin towns and sister cities in the Netherlands}} ===Twin towns — Sister cities=== Gennep is [[town twinning|twinned]] with: {| class="wikitable" |- valign="top" | * {{flagicon|Slovakia}} [[Gelnica]], [[Slovakia]] |} ==References== <references/> == External links == {{commonscat}} *[http://www.gennep.nl Official website] <!--Please note that not all directions need to be filled--> <!--Please note that preferably only neighboring municipalities or bodies of water should be used--> {{Geographic location |Centre = Gennep |North = [[Kranenburg, North Rhine-Westphalia|Kranenburg]] ([[Germany|DE]]-[[North Rhine-Westphalia|NW]]) |Northeast = |East = [[Goch]] ([[Germany|DE]]-[[North Rhine-Westphalia|NW]]) |Southeast = |South = [[Bergen, Limburg|Bergen]] |Southwest = |West = [[Cuijk]] ([[North Brabant|NB]]) / ''[[Meuse (river)|Meuse]]''<br>[[Boxmeer]] ([[North Brabant|NB]]) / ''[[Meuse (river)|Meuse]]'' |Northwest = [[Mook en Middelaar]], [[Groesbeek]] ([[Gelderland|GE]]) }} {{Limburg Province (Netherlands)}} [[Category:Populated places in Limburg (Netherlands)]] [[Category:Municipalities of Limburg (Netherlands)]] {{LimburgNL-geo-stub}}
